page.title: 04Coal Mining
page.content: Each dragline cost four million pounds to buy and two million pounds to put together. Altogether there are 165 people working at the mine. Once the coal has been dug up, it has to be screened and then it travels by train to the power station. The coal-miners start work at 7 o'clock and finish at 6 o'clock. When we started mining here five years ago, the men had to put a big fence round the site. Then the big scrapers had to move about 30 cm of top soil, followed by the subsoil. The two draglines are used to help move the soil. The coal is taken by big lorries to the train. After all the coal is taken out of the site, it will be restored and used for farming.
